Nominated by leadership, these individuals from Harvard’s Schools and offices share what the University means to them, capturing the many important contributions Harvard community members at all levels make on a daily basis.

In honor of the inauguration, members of the community submitted greetings to welcome Larry and his wife Adele. These images captured the spaces, moments, and people that make Harvard special, and all tell a unique story about the University.
Harvard’s new president Larry Bacow returns to his roots

In one of his first official trips as president, Larry Bacow headed back to his hometown of Pontiac, Michigan, where he revisited childhood memories and met with students, educators, Harvard alumni, state and local leaders, and made the national case for college.
